required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety, Immunogenicity and Efficacy of Investigational Flu Vaccine Compared to Approved Flu Vaccine in Children.
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Stratified, Randomized, Observer Blind, Controlled, Multicenter Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety, Immunogenicity and Efficacy of an Adjuvanted Quadrivalent Subunit Influenza Virus Vaccine Compared to Non-Adjuvanted Comparator Influenza Vaccine in Children ≥6 to < 72 Months of Age.

brief_summary.textblock: Safety, Immunogenicity and Efficacy of an Adjuvanted Quadrivalent Subunit Influenza Virus Vaccine Compared to Non-Adjuvanted Comparator Influenza Vaccine in Children ≥6 to <72 Months of Age.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: RT-PCR-confirmed influenza cases in all subjects
primary_outcome.time_frame: Weekly from Day 1 up to 180 days after the last vaccination or until the end of the influenza season, whichever is longer
primary_outcome.description: The relative efficacy of aQIV compared to comparator vaccine as determined by RT-PCR-confirmed influenza

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with solicited AEs
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate safety and tolerability of each study vaccine

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with all unsolicited AEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: vaccine-naïve subjects: Day 1 to Day 50; vaccine non-naïve subjects: Day 1 to 22

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with SAEs, AEs leading to withdrawal from the study or study vaccination, new onset of chronic disease, Adverse Event of Special Interest (AESI) and all medications associated
Hazard ratios calculated: Occurrence of RT-PCR and culture-confirmed influenza cases in all subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: occurring at ≥ 21 days and ≤ 180 days after the last vaccination or until the end of the influenza season, whichever is longer,
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy: The relative efficacy of aQIV compared to comparator as determined by the proportion of subjects with culture-confirmed influenza The relative efficacy of aQIV compared to comparator as determined by RT-PCR-confirmed and culture-confirmed influenza in age subgroups, in children at risk of influenza, and in children depending on previous vaccination status The early relative efficacy of aQIV compared to comparator as determined by RT-PCR-confirmed influenza

secondary_outcome.measure: Hazard ratios calculated: Early occurrence of RT-PCR-confirmed influenza cases in all subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: on first-occurrence of RT-PCR-confirmed influenza cases
vaccine naïve subjects: on Day 1, Day 29, Day 50 and Day 209, vaccine non-naïve subjects: on Day 1, Day 22 and Day 181
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity: To compare antibody responses between aQIV and comparator (including assessment of non-inferiority and superiority) The endpoints for immunogenicity measured in aQIV and comparator as determined by HI.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: vaccine naïve subjects on Day 29/Day 1, Day 50/Day 1 and Day 209/Day 1, vaccine non-naïve: Day 22/Day 1 and Day 181/Day 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of vaccine naïve and non-naïve subjects achieving seroconversion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: vaccine naïve subjects: on Day 29 and Day 50, vaccine non-naïve subjects: on Day 22

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with HI titer ≥ 1:40
secondary_outcome.time_frame: vaccine naïve subjects on Day 29, Day 50 and Day 209, vaccine non-naïve: Day 22 and Day 181

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with higher HI titer thresholds
secondary_outcome.time_frame: vaccine naïve subjects on Day 29, Day 50 and Day 209, vaccine non-naïve: Day 22 and Day 181

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with all unsolicited AEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from Day 1 to Day 50, vaccine non-naïve subjects from Day 1 to Day 22

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with SAEs, AEs leading to withdrawal from the study or study vaccination, New Onset of Chronic Disease (NOCD), Adverse Events of Special Interest(AESI) and all medications associated

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with a medical visit for respiratory illness associated with RT-PCR-confirmed influenza
other_outcome.time_frame: within a window of 14 days after ILI-onset
other_outcome.description: Health Economic Outcome: To evaluate healthcare utilization and health economic outcomes

other_outcome.measure: Number of employment days missed by parent(s)/guardian(s) of subjects with RT-PCR-confirmed influenza
other_outcome.time_frame: within a window of 14 days after ILI-onset

other_outcome.measure: Number of days of daycare, school or preschool missed by subjects associated with RT-PCR-confirmed influenza
other_outcome.time_frame: within a window of 14 days after ILI-onset

intervention.intervention_name: Adjuvanted Quadrivalent Subunit Influenza Virus Vaccine (aQIV)
intervention.description: 1 or 2 doses (naïve / non-naive subjects) 0.25 ml: ≥6 months to <36 months, 0.5 ml: ≥36 months to <72 months

intervention.intervention_name: Non-adjuvanted Trivalent Influenza Vaccine (TIV) / Quadrivalent Influenza Vaccine (QIV)
intervention.description: 1 or 2 doses (naïve / non-naive subjects) 0.25 ml: ≥6 months to <36 months, 0.5 ml: ≥36 months to <72 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children, males and females, healthy or at high risk of complications from influenza, between ≥6 months to <72 months of age
- Documented consent provided by the subject's parent(s)/legal guardian(s)
- Subjects and/or subject's parent(s)/legal guardian(s) able to comply with all study procedures.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children with history of allergy to vaccine components.
- Additional eligibility criteria may be discussed by contacting the site
